p: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), the cause of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, is the worst challenge for a century for international health and financial systems. It was declared a global pandemic on 11th March 2020, 6 weeks after it had first been reported from China as a new respiratory virus [1]. By then 118,000 cases had been reported from 114 countries, and 4291 people reported to have lost their lives [1]. Only 7 weeks later, as of 4th May, 3,467,321 cases of COVID-19, including 246,979 deaths, have been reported from 187 countries and territories, and maritime quarantine [2].
